intro: Alsinopsis howellii, commonly known as the Howell's alsinopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
